name: Janek at the Gym
description:
Janek has started going to the gym, and in order to maximize his results, he consulted with a personal trainer who created a workout plan for him (each exercise is denoted by a natural number). However, Janek really dislikes performing the same exercises in sequence at the gym.
Determine the length of the longest contiguous subsequence of exercises that Janek will perform without repetition during the given training session. The standard input will consist of two lines.
The first line contains a single integer number n (1≤n≤1000000), indicating the number of exercises performed during the training session. The second line contains n integer numbers separated by spaces in range of 1 to 1000, each integer representing the exercise number performed by Janek.
The program should return a single integer to the standard output, indicating the length of the longest contiguous subsequence of exercises that Janek will perform with a smile on his face.

Example 1
Input:
8
1 2 3 1 2 3 2 2
Output: 3

Example 2
Input:
5
1 1 1 1 1
Output: 1

Example 3
Input:
6
8 4 4 5 1 4
Output: 3
